content:
• Thursday, December 6, 2018
  • DOMO

    AVGO, ULTA and RFP among after hours movers

    • Top Gainers: DOMO +14%. CMTL +8.3%. ASNS +5.5%. AVGO +3.4%.
    • Top Losers: RFP -32.8%. ULTA 6.3%. UNFI -6.2%.ZUMZ -5.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM
  • YELP

    Yelp to join S&P MidCap 400, Gulfport Energy moves to SmallCap 600

    • Yelp (NYSE:YELP) +4.1% following news it will join the S&P MidCap 400, replacing Gulfport Energy (NASDAQ:GPOR), which will drop down to the S&P SmallCap 600, effective prior to the open on Dec. 12.
    • Dropping out of the SmallCap 600 is Oclaro (NASDAQ:OCLR), which will be acquired by MidCap 400 constituent Lumentum in a deal expected to be completed soon pending final conditions.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM
  • AOBC

    American Outdoor Brands +14% after Q2 beat, raised guidance

    • American Outdoor Brands (NASDAQ:AOBC) +13.8% after-hours as it handily beats FQ2 earnings and revenue estimates and guides Q3 earnings and FY 2019 above consensus.
    • AOBC says Q2 results reflect Y/Y increases in revenue and profitability in both the Firearms segment and the Outdoor Products & Accessories segment, which the company first entered just four years ago and now generates about one third of total revenue.
    • The Smith & Wesson gunmaker issues upside guidance for Q3, seeing EPS of $0.09-$0.13 vs. $0.09 analyst consensus estimate, on revenues of $155M-$165M vs. $157M consensus.
    • For the full year, the company raises its EPS forecast to $0.69-$0.73 from $0.62-$0.66 previously and ahead of $0.65 analyst consensus, on revenues of $625M-$635M vs. $620M-$630M previously and $625M consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • DOMO

    Domo +6% on Q3 revenue beat

    • Domo (NASDAQ:DOMO) gains 6.3% on Q3 results that and revenue estimates with a reported $36.8M (consensus: $34.98M) with EPS of -$1.06 (Capital IQ consensus: -$1.38, not clear if comparable). Q4 guidance has upside revenue of $37.5M to $37.9M (consensus: $35.73M) with EPS of -$1.27 to -$1.23 (consensus: -$1.39, not clear if comparable).
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Domo Technologies reports Q3 results (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • DOMO

    Domo Technologies reports Q3 results

    • Domo Technologies (NASDAQ:DOMO): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of -$1.06; GAAP EPS of -$1.24.
    • Revenue of $36.84M (+30.2% Y/Y)
    • Shares +2.37%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • AVGO

    Broadcom +6% on Q4 beats with Wireless strength

    • Broadcom (NASDAQ:AVGO) gains 6.1% aftermarket on Q4 results that beat estimates with 12% Y/Y revenue growth. FY19 guidance has revenue at $24.5B (consensus: $22.58B) with a 51% operating margin and $550M capex.
    • Revenue breakdown: Wired Infrastructure, $2.21B (consensus: $2.29B); Wireless Communications, $1.70B (consensus: $1.63B); Enterprise Storage, $1.27B (consensus: $1.24B); Industrial & Other, $272M (consensus: $240.1M)
    • Non-GAAP gross margin was 68.4%, above the 67% consensus, and operating margin was 52.3% (consensus: 50.7%).
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Broadcom beats by $0.27, beats on revenue (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM | 24 Comments
  • DOCU

    DocuSign reports Q3 beats with upside guide, exec changes

    • DocuSign (NASDAQ:DOCU) drops 0.2% aftermarket on Q3 results that beat estimates with revenue up 37% Y/Y. Upside Q4 guidance has revenue from $192M to $194M (consensus: $189.4M). Upside FY19 guidance has revenue of $693M to $695M (consensus: $687M).
    • Revenue breakdown: Subscription, $169.4M (consensus: $165.8M); Professional Services and Other, $9.0M (consensus: $8.0M).
    • Billings totaled $198M compared to the $174.7M consensus.
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 4:30 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
    • Board and exec changes: DocuSign announces that current board member Maggie Wilderotter will become chair, effective January 1.
    • Pivotal Software SVP and CFO Cynthia Gaylor will join the board.
    • Current CMO Scott Orlich will expand his role to also cover the COO position.
    • Current SVP of North America sales Loren Alhadeff will step into the newly created Chief Revenue Officer role, effective February 1.
    • Previously: DocuSign beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 4 Comments
  • LULU

    Lululemon falls 6% despite earnings topper

    • Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) reports comparable store sales were up 6% in Q3. Including online sales, comparable sales increased 17%.
    • Direct to consumer revenue rose 44% to rep 25.3% of total sales.
    • Revenue from China was up 71% during the quarter.
    • Gross margin was up 110 bps to 54.4% of sales vs. 52.2% a year ago.
    • Adjusted operating margin was up 80 bps Y/Y off the extra sales leverage.
    • The company expects Q4 revenue of $1.115B to $1.125B vs. $1.12B and Q4 EPS of  EPS of $1.64 to $1.67 vs. $1.65 consensus. Full-year EPS $3.65 to $3.68 is anticipated vs. $3.60 consensus.
    • LULU -6.3% AH after shedding 1.6% before the bell.
    • Previously: Lululemon Athletica beats by $0.06, beats on revenue (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 14 Comments
  • QTNT

    Quotient Limited readies stock offering; shares down 6% after hours

    • Quotient Limited (NASDAQ:QTNT) initiates a public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Shares are down 6% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • GBT

    Global Blood launches $150M stock offering; shares down 4% after hours

    • Global Blood Therapeutics (NASDAQ:GBT) commences a $150M public offering of common stock. Underwriters over-allotment is an additional $22.5M of stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Shares are down 4% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 17 Comments
  • AVGO

    Broadcom beats by $0.27, beats on revenue

    • Broadcom (NASDAQ:AVGO): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $5.85 beats by $0.27; GAAP EPS of $2.64 misses by $0.51.
    • Revenue of $5.44B (+12.4% Y/Y) beats by $40M.
    • Shares +4.5%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 32 Comments
  • VIVE

    Viveve Medical's CMRF shows positive action in stress urinary incontinence study

    • Results from a 12-month feasibility study evaluating Viveve Medical's (NASDAQ:VIVE) cryogen-cooled monopolar radiofrequency (CMRF) technology platform for the treatment of women with mild-to-moderate stress urinary incontinence (SUI) showed a treatment effect.
    • At month 12, 72% (n=18/25) of participants responded. 52% of patients experienced greater than a 50% reduction in the 1-hour Pad Weight Test.
    • Clinically meaningful benefits were achieved across all patient-reported outcome measures.
    • No safety signals were observed.
    • The first of two planned randomized studies, LIBERATE-International, in SUI has been initiated. An IDE for the second, LIBERATE-U.S., will be filed in Q3 2019. The data, if positive, will support marketing applications.
    • The company will host a webcast of its Key Opinion Leader Symposium on SUI on December 11 at 10:00 am ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • ULTA

    Comp sales up 8% at Ulta Beauty

    • Ulta Beauty (NASDAQ:ULTA) reports comparable sales increased 7.8% in Q3 to match the expectation of analysts.
    • Transactions were up 5.3% during the quarter and the average ticket was 2.5% higher.
    • Retail comparable sales increased 4.4%, including salon comparable sales growth of 3.5%.
    • E-commerce sales increased 43% to $171M.
    • Gross margin as a percentage of sales was flat Y/Y at 36.7%.
    • SGA& expenses were up 140 bps to 25.3% of sales.
    • Operating income increased 4.0% to $169M to rep 10.8% of sales vs. 12.1% a year ago.
    • Looking ahead, Ulta Beauty expects Q4 sales of $2.085B to $2.103B vs. $2.12B consensus.
    • ULTA -4.6% AH to $279.62.
    • Previously: Ulta Beauty beats by $0.02, revenue in-line (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 7 Comments
  • AOBC

    American Outdoor Brands beats by $0.06, beats on revenue

    • American Outdoor Brands (NASDAQ:AOBC): Q2 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.06; GAAP EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.06.
    • Revenue of $161.7M (+8.9% Y/Y) beats by $7.61M.
    • Shares +2.95%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • KIDS

    OrthoPediatrics launches 1.5M-share stock offering

    • Orthopediatrics (NASDAQ:KIDS) commences a public offering of 1.5M common shares. Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 225K shares. Price and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM

  • Fed floats possible pause - stocks scream into close

    • The WSJ's Nick Timiraos reports the Fed is considering adopting a "wait-and-see" approach after a rate hike this month.
    • At a minimum, this would mean stepping back from the path of quarterly rate hikes that's been the rule for about the last two years.
    • The news helped stocks continue to rally from this morning's near-3% declines. At the close, the Nasdaq is up 0.4% and S&P 500 down 0.15%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 278 Comments

  • Stocks claw back from big losses

    • Down more than 2% earlier in the session, Nasdaq has turned green minutes before the closing bell. The S&P 500 and DJIA have shaved their large early declines to down 0.3% and down 0.4%, respectively.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM | 4 Comments
  • BA

    Boeing CEO hopeful for resolution of U.S.-China trade dispute but shares -4%

    • Boeing (BA -3.7%) CEO Dennis Muilenburg tells CNBC he is "hopeful coming out of the G20 summit that we are on a path to finding a trade agreement with China that's going to be productive," but shares nevertheless are the day's worst performer on the Dow, sliding as much as 7.5% before paring losses.
    • Muilenburg also said 737 MAX is a "safe aircraft" despite the October Lion Air crash that killing all 189 passengers; Indonesia said today it would immediately impose new requirements for simulator training for 737 MAX pilots in the wake of the crash.
    • An automated flight control system on the 737 MAX was largely omitted from the plane’s operations manual and was the subject of debate inside Boeing, WSJ reports, citing government and industry officials.
    • Another Indonesian carrier, Garuda, says it will keep taking deliveries of the 737 MAX, giving the new aircraft a vote of confidence even as local rival Lion Air threatens to cancel its $22B order.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 8 Comments
  • ABEO

    Abeona to launch pivotal study of EB-101 in RDEB in mid-2019, new CF program launched; shares up 6%

    • Abeona Therapeutics (ABEO +5.9%) is up on average volume following its pipeline update during its R&D Day. Highlights:
    • A Phase 3 study, VITAL, evaluating lead candidate EB-101, a gene-corrected cell therapy, in recessive dystrophic epidermolysis bullosa (RDEB) will be launched in mid-2019. The primary endpoint will be the proportion of treated wounds with at least 50% healing at month 3.
    • GMP manufacturing facility in Cleveland, OH, established for EB-101.
    • The ongoing Phase 1/2 clinical trial evaluating ABO-102 in Sanfilippo syndrome type A (MPS IIIA) will be amended to include patients with earlier-stage disease. Substantial dose-related improvement in biomarkers have been observed.
    • First program for its AIM vector platform, ABO-401, established for the potential treatment of cystic fibrosis (CF). The company says it is designed to correct the underlying CF chloride channel deficit regardless of CFTR mutation status.
    • IND for ABO-202 in infantile Batten disease to be filed next quarter.
    • EB-101 and ABO-102 have Regenerative Medicine Advanced Therapy status in the U.S. which provides for accelerated review of the marketing applications.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • CLDR

    Cloud stocks see green after Cloudera earnings

    • Cloud-related tech stocks move against the pressure and into the green following yesterday's Cloudera (CLDR +12.2%) earnings report.
    • The First Trust Cloud Computing ETF (NASDAQ:SKYY) is down 0.3% compared to the 0.5% drop for the Nasdaq.
    • Among the movers: (WDAY +1.4%), (TWLO +6.4%), (BOX +1.9%), (SPLK +1.3%), (DATA +2.9%), (HDP +12.4%), (NOW +2.4%).
    • Previously: Cloudera reports Q3 beats (Dec. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 10 Comments
  • MDCA

    MDC +24% on reported Accenture interest

    • MDC Partners (NASDAQ:MDCA) jumps 24% on an AdWeek report that Accenture (NYSE:ACN) is among the final bidders to acquire the network.
    • LionTree Advisors and JP Morgan Chase are reportedly overseeing the process.
    • AdWeek's source says the bid deadline was late November and Accenture is one of three finalists. The source says Accenture is the "best bidder."
    • MDC Partners has over 50 properties and currently has more than $1B in debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 3 Comments
  • DNSKF

    Danske Bank +4.1% as cooperation may help reduce fines

    • Danske Bank (OTCPK:DNSKF +4.1%) +4.1% after a Danish financial regulator says the bank's cooperation and management overhaul may help to scale back any fines imposed against the Danish bank, according to Bloomberg.
    • So far the bank has set aside about $2.7B to deal with potential fines for one of Europe's biggest money-laundering scandals.
    • Jesper Berg, head of Denmark's financial regulator, says the bank's cooperation with authorities combined with its "draconian" changes in management will likely be taken into account when regulators determine monetary penalties.
    • Denmark won't be the only agency assessing fines. Danske Bank is also being investigated by the U.S. Justice Department, which could issue the heaviest fines.
    • Since the money-laundering scandal revolving around its tiny Estonian branch came to light in October, Danske has removed its CEO. Its chairman was pushed out by its biggest shareholder after a number of senior managers exited.
    • Previously: Danske Bank charged with violating anti-money-laundering law (Nov. 28)
    • Previously: Deutsche Bank handled about $150B of Danske's fishy funds: WSJ (Nov. 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • TST

    MOMO, NPTN and TST among notable tech movers

    • Gainers: TheStreet (NASDAQ:TST) +32%. Uxin (NASDAQ:UXIN) +31%. Remark Holdings (NASDAQ:MARK) +26%. Zscaler (NASDAQ:ZS) +14%. Finjan Holdings (NASDAQ:FNJN) +13%.
    • Losers: Cool Holdings (NASDAQ:AWSM) -22%. Methode Electronic (NYSE:MEI) -21%. SigmaTron International (NASDAQ:SGMA) -21%. NeoPhotonics Corporation (NYSE:NPTN) -17%. Momo (NASDAQ:MOMO) -14%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 4 Comments
  • BA

    Brazil court order blocks proposed Boeing-Embraer deal

    • A Brazilian federal court issues a decision blocking the proposed tie-up between planemakers Boeing (BA -4.4%) and Embraer (ERJ -3%), according to Reuters.
    • The legal action was brought by four congressmen with Brazil’s leftist Workers Party; labor groups in Brazil frequently bring court challenges against big business deals, and resulting injunctions often are reversed.
    • The companies announced in July that Embraer would sell 80% of its commercial aviation business to Boeing.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM | 9 Comments
  • KTOS

    Kratos +5.3% on takeover speculation

    • Kratos Defense & Security Solutions (NASDAQ:KTOS) gains 5.3% on headlines suggesting Dealreporter said takeover interest has "ramped up."
    • As always with these kinds of M&A headlines, take with a grain of salt.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM | 17 Comments
  • BHP

    BHP faces China problems, but analysts split on how investors should react

    • BHP (BHP -2.9%) slides after J.P. Morgan downgrades shares to Neutral from Overweight, saying the stock has outperformed Rio Tinto (RIO -2.7%) by 10% YTD and is now trading "within range of our valuation."
    • "The prospect of six months of negative China data (before potentially stabilizing in the second half of 2019) presents a difficult headwind for the sector," JPM analyst Lyndon Faganwrites, prompting him to take a more neutral stance on the mining sector even as the companies sport strong free cash flow and balance sheets.
    • But the pessimistic view is not shared by Goldman Sachs, which adds the stock to its Conviction Buy List, saying shares are undervalued despite China weakness and foreseeing further upside from share buybacks, superior margins and non-core divestment potential.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • TROX

    Tronox -22% as late bid to save Cristal deal includes Ashtabula plant sale

    • Tronox (TROX -22.4%) plunges to a 52-week low following a last-ditch effort to salvage its $2.4B acquisition of titanium dioxide producing peer Cristal via a proposal to sell Cristal's pigment site in Ashtabula, Ohio, to INEOS for $700M.
    • TROX says the proposed sale of the Ashtabula site, which has two plants with a combined capacity of 245K metric tons/year, should address concerns from U.S. antitrust regulators.
    • TROX says it filed a motion with an administrative law judge to seek permission to present the proposed sale as a remedy to address concerns from the Federal Trade Commission, and it asks the court to decide within five days whether there is a reasonable possibility of a settlement.
    • The company faces a deadline of Dec. 19 to gain U.S. regulatory approval for the Cristal deal.
    • TROX and three other peers - Venator Materials (VNTR -18.8%), Kronos Worldwide (KRO -8.3%) and Chemours (CC -3.5%) - all hit new 52-week lows today, although each has recovered some ground.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM | 11 Comments
  • TNXP

    Tonix Pharma files for upsized equity offering; shares dow 19%

    • Nano cap Tonix Pharmaceuticals Holding (TNXP -19.4%) is down on below-average on the heels of its preliminary prospectus for a public offering of 2,132,701 Class A Units and 9,000 Class B Units
    • Each Class A Unit consists of one share of common stock and one warrant to purchase one common share at 125% of the Class A Unit price.
    • Each Class B Unit consists of one Series A Preferred Share valued at $1,000 and one warrant to purchase 237 common shares.
    • The preliminary prospectus filed on Monday was for ~1.3M Class A Units with less valuable warrants (in terms of number of shares).
    • Previously: Tonix Pharmaceuticals files for equity offering (Dec. 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 6 Comments
  • DFRG

    Hedgeye sees more upside for Del Frisco's

    • Del Frisco's Restaurant Group (DFRG +11.1%) lands on the list of Best Idea Long picks at Hedgeye.
    • Previously: Del Frisco's plays defense against Engaged Capital (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • KLXE

    KLX Energy Services among Energy/Materials gainers; Sanchez Midstream Partners and Centrus Energy among losers

    • Gainers: KLX Energy Services (NASDAQ:KLXE) +26%.
    • Losers: Sanchez Midstream Partners (NYSEMKT:SNMP) -28%. Centrus Energy (NYSEMKT:LEU) -23%. Tronox (NYSE:TROX) -21%. Venator Materials (NYSE:VNTR) -18%. ION Geophysical (NYSE:IO) -15%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • KNSA

    Kiniksa Pharma down 15% on FDA hold on mavrilimumab

    • Thinly traded Kiniksa Pharmaceuticals (KNSA -14.6%) is down on below-average volume on the heels of its announcement that the FDA has placed a clinical hold on its mavrilimumab IND. The agency has requested additional information regarding the delivery device to be used in its Phase 2 clinical trial in giant cell arteritis.
    • The company says the delivery device is currently cleared for sale in the U.S. and it is providing the requested information.
    • Previously: Kiniksa readies $126M IPO (May 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • NTEC

    Intec Pharma up 2% on advancement of Accordion Pill with Novartis

    • Thinly traded micro cap Intec Pharma (NTEC +1.9%) is up on 80% higher volume in reaction to its announcement that its program with Novartis (NVS -3%) aimed at developing the Accordion Pill for an unnamed compound will proceed to a clinical pharmacokinetic study in H1 2019.
    • Previously: Intec nabs new U.S. patent protecting Accordion Pill technology; shares ahead 4% (May 24, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • TSLA

    Tesla pokes out gain amid broad market declines

    • Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) is up 1.3% on the day, despite a day of broad market declines. A positive note from Wolfe Research on margin potential and price target bump on shares to $430 (18% upside) could be helping to bring in some buyers.
    • Wolfe on TSLA: "Tesla’s volume growth opportunity has been clear for some time, but persistent cash burn made it impossible for the broad investor community to evaluate the margin profile and the company’s ability to self-fund capital growth. In turn, substantial external funding needs made the risk profile unfavorable. This has limited the investor pool to essentially 'true believers', driven persistent short interest, and kept the market cap largely range-bound for 4 years."
    • Previously: Tesla to start Chinese production late next year (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM | 81 Comments
  • BMY

    Bristol-Myers Squibb bucks selloff, up 2% on bullish call at BMO

    • Bristol-Myers Squibb (BMY +1.9%) is up on below-average volume on the heels of an upgrade to Outperform with a $60 (13% upside) price target at BMO. Analyst Alex Arfaei likes the upside for top seller Opdivo (nivolumab) in first-line lung cancer. He also expects Opdivo to maintain its 30-40% share in second-line (and later) non-small cell lung cancer.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM | 2 Comments
  • VBIV

    VBI Vaccines out-licenses VBI-2601 for up to $129M; shares up 4%

    • Thinly traded micro cap VBI Vaccines (VBIV +3.8%) is up on a 10x surge in volume in reaction to its license and collaboration agreement with privately held Brii Biosciences aimed at developing and commercializing immuno-therapeutic VBI-2601 for the treatment of chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection in China.
    • Under the terms of the deal, VBIV will receive $11M upfront ($4M in cash plus a $7M equity investment at $3.05/share), up to $117.5M in milestones and double-digit royalties on net sales in China, Hong Kong, Macau and Taiwan.
    • The companies will collaborate on development through a proof-of-concept study in China. Afterward, Brii will be responsible for all development in the territory. VBIV retains all rights outside of the territory.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM | 4 Comments
  • IMMU

    Immunomedics' sacituzumab govitecan shows positive effect in mid-stage TNBC study

    • Updated results from a Phase 2 clinical trial evaluating Immunomedics' (IMMU +0.2%) antibody-drug candidate sacituzumab govitecan (SG) in patients with metastatic triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) showed a treatment benefit. The data were presented at the San Antonio Breast Cancer Symposium.
    • The objective response rate was 33% (n=36/108), including three complete responders. The disease control rate (responders + stable cancer) was 45% (n=49/108). Median duration of response was 7.7 months.
    • A Phase 3 study assessing SG in heavily pretreated patients with HR+/HER2- metastatic breast cancer should launch soon.
    • The company's U.S. marketing application under Priority Review status is currently under FDA review with an action date of January 18, 2019.
    • Previously: FDA accepts Immunomedics' BLA for sacituzumab govitecan for mTNBC; shares up 2% premarket (July 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM
  • MARPS

    Marine Petroleum Trust leads financial gainers; LM Funding America and SVB Financial among losers

    • Gainers: Marine Petroleum Trust (NASDAQ:MARPS) +13%. LGI Homes (NASDAQ:LGIH) +6%.
    • Losers: Hexindai (NASDAQ:HX) -27%. SVB Financial Group (NASDAQ:SIVB) -11%. AllianceBernstein Holding (NYSE:AB) -10%. LM Funding America (NASDAQ:LMFA) -9%. Spirit MTA REIT (NYSE:SMTA) -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • RARE

    Health Canada OKs Kyowa Hakko Kirin and Ultagenyx's Crysvita

    • Kyowa Hakko Kirin and collaboration partner Ultragenyx Pharmaceutical (RARE +1.3%) announce that Health Canada has approved Crysvita (burosumab) for the treatment of X-linked hypophosphatemia, an inherited form of vitamin D deficiency, in patients at least one year old.
    • Market launch will begin early next quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM

  • Nasdaq leads as averages trim losses

    • Losses in the S&P 500 and DJIA approaching 3% have been nearly halved in early afternoon action.
    • The Nasdaq, meanwhile, is now off just 0.5%, with notable players like Google, Amazon, Netflix and the gaming stocks all in the green.
    • ETFs: XLK, VGT, TECL, FTEC, IYW, ROM, QTEC, RYT, FNG, TECS, IGM, FXL, XNTK, REW, JHMT, XITK, TECZ
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM | 4 Comments
  • TTWO

    Take-Two leads gaming names higher

    • The averages are firmly in the red, but the gaming players are having a good session. In the news are changes to Take Two Interactive's (TTWO +4.6%) Red Dead.
    • Activision (ATVI +2.4%), Electronic Arts (EA +2.6%)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM | 3 Comments
  • COST

    Costco rallies after sizzling comp

    • Costco (COST +2.7%) trades higher on a bruising day for the market overall as investors give the retailer credit for another strong month of comparable sales.
    • Costco's +10.2% comp in the U.S. more than doubled the consensus estimate for a 4.9% gain.
    • Previously: Costco updates November sales (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 11 Comments
  • PBYI

    Puma Bio's neratinib + fulvestrant showed positive effect in mid-stage breast cancer study

    • Results from an ongoing Phase 2 basket study, SUMMIT, evaluating the combination of Puma Biotechnology's (PBYI -4.7%) NERLYNX (neratinib) and AstraZeneca's (AZN -2.9%) FASLODEX (fulvestrant) in patients with HER2- or HER3-positive solid tumors showed a treatment benefit. The data were presented at the San Antonio Breast Cancer Symposium.
    • In the group of patients with HR+/HER2+ breast cancer who received the combination, the confirmed overall response rate was 30% (n=14/47), including four complete responders. The disease control rate (responders + stable disease) was 47% (n=22/47). Median duration of response was 9.2 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • UXIN

    Puma Bio's neratinib shows incremental effect in certain HER2+ breast cancer patients in late-stage study; shares down 4%

    • Results from the Phase 3 ExteNET study from a subgroup of HER2-positive breast cancer patients who received Puma Biotechnology's (PBYI -4%) NERLYNX (neratinib) within one year of completing adjuvant therapy with Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY -2.2%) Herceptin (trastuzumab) showed a modest treatment benefit over placebo. The data were presented at the San Antonio Breast Cancer Symposium.
    • The rate of invasive disease-free survival (iDFS) at year two of follow-up as 95.3% compared to 90.8% for placebo (p=0.002). After five years of follow-up, iDFS in the neratinib group was 90.8% compared to 85.7% for control (p=0.002).

  • VALE

    Vale expects 390M metric tons of iron ore output in 2018, 400M thereafter

    • Vale (VALE -2.9%) says it sees FY 2018 iron ore production of 390M metric tons before reaching a ceiling of 400M metric tons in 2019, which it expects to maintain at least through 2023.
    • Vale's iron ore will continue on a track to increase high-grade and lower-impurity materials and pellets, CEO Fabio Schvartsman says, as he expects China's demand for higher-grade ores to cut pollution and boost efficiency "is here to stay."
    • Vale also expects to produce 244K metric tons of nickel in 2019, and raise volumes to 313K tons/year in the "short-term" and 400K tons/year in the "medium term," amid an expected surge in demand in metals for use in electric vehicles.
    • The CEO also says the recent drop in global steel prices is temporary due to overproduction in China ahead of winter output cuts.
    • Schvartsman says global capacity utilization in the steel sector has climbed to 76% this year from 73% last year, indicating excess capacity in the sector is shrinking, giving steelmakers pricing power.
    • Finally, the CEO says the Samarco mine in Brazil likely will restart in early 2020, bringing a major source of high-grade iron ore back into the market.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM

  • TELL

    Tellurian signs initial offtake deal for proposed Driftwood LNG export project

    • Tellurian (TELL -8.2%) says it signed an MoU with commodity trader Vitol to supply 1.5M metric tons/year of liquefied natural gas for 15 years from its LNG offtake capacity at the proposed Driftwood LNG export terminal in Louisiana.
    • The MoU is TELL’s first preliminary offtake deal for the Driftwood project; the company said last month that it was on track to make a final investment decision on the project.
    • The deal prices the LNG against Platt’s Japan Korea Marker, the first time the daily assessment of spot LNG prices in northern Asia has been used for a long-term offtake agreement, according to S&P Global Platts.
    • TELL says Vitol also is evaluating a potential equity investment in the Driftwood partnership.

  • BYSI

    BeyondSpring's lead candidate on par with Amgen's Neulasta in late-stage study; shares ahead 3%

    • Ultra-thinly traded BeyondSpring (BYSI +3.2%) is up on almost double normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 12K shares, on the heels of its announcement of positive results evaluating lead candidate Plinabulin in patients receiving docetaxel chemotherapy.
    • The study met the primary endpoint of demonstrating the non-inferiority (no worse than) of Plinabulin compared to Amgen's (AMGN -1.7%) NEULASTA (pegfilgrastim) in reducing the duration of severe neutropenia (low levels of a type of white blood cell called neutrophils) in the first cycle of chemo.
    • The company plans to file a marketing applications in China and the U.S. seeking approval for Plinabulin for the treatment of chemo-induced neutropenia.
    • The company acquired global rights to Plinabulin, a small molecule synthetic analogue of a marine microbial product, from San Diego-based Nereus Pharmaceuticals in 2013.

    • Crude oil prices remain sharply lower in volatile trading after OPEC members say they agreed to production cuts but must await Russia before making a final decision on the exact amount and the allocation: WTI -3.9% at $50.79/bbl, Brent -3.2% at $59.56/bbl.
    • Russian Energy Minister Novak flew to St. Petersburg from Vienna earlier to consult Pres. Putin and will return to the OPEC meeting for talks tomorrow.
    • Saudi Energy Minister al-Falih sent prices plummeting as much as 5% earlier after saying a production deal had not yet been reached.
    • A potential 1M bbl/day cut "may disappoint many but should the cut be from a September or October baseline, rather than November, the net impact would be sufficient to limit storage builds," says Pimco's Greg Sharenow. "It is unlikely to spark a meaningful price rally but also will not be so dire either. In many respects it is the middle road, which may be the optimal solution."

  • EW

    Edwards Lifesciences updates on pipeline; sees 2019 sales of $3.9B - 4.3B; shares up 2%

    • At its annual investor conference yesterday in California, Edwards Lifesciences (EW +1.9%) reviewed its pipeline and its outlook for this year and next. Highlights:
    • TAVR business: sales could reach ~$7B by 2024 on the basis of broader indications, technology advances and greater disease and therapy awareness. U.S. approval of SAPIEN 3 should happen this month. U.S. study of CENTERA valve is ongoing. Commercial rollout in Europe underway. Results from PARTNER 3 study of SAPIEN 3 in low-risk surgical patients should be available in March 2019. Low-risk indication expected in late 2019. Single-arm study of TAVR in underrepresented and minority populations to be launched in 2019. Pivotal study evaluating transcatheter system to treat pulmonic valves to launch in Q1 2019. EARLY TAVR study assessing SAPIEN 3 THV in presymptomatic severe aortic stenosis patients should be fully enrolled in 2020.
    • TMTT business: sales could reach ~$3B by 2024. European launch of PASCAL system for mitral patients in mid-2019. Enrollment continuing in PASCAL CLASP DMR study in U.S. PASCAL CLASP FMR and SAPIEN M3 pivotal U.S. studies to launch in lat 2019. Enrollment has been paused in the Cardioband ACTIVE MR study to evaluate the trial design. Cardioband ACTIVE TR study in U.S. to be launched in late 2019.
    • 2018 guidance: Sales: higher end of $3.5B - 3.9B; THVT sales growth: ~12.5% from 11 - 15%; SHVT sales growth: 2-4% (unch); CC sales growth: above the top end of 6-8%; non-GAAP EPS: $4.60 - 4.75 from $4.10 - 4.30; non-GAAP free cash flow: higher end of $700M - 775M.
    • 2019 guidance: Sales: $3.9B - 4.3B; TAVR sales: $2.4B - 2.7B; TMTT sales: $~$40M; Surgical Structural Heart (formerly SHVT): $810M - 850M; Critical Care: $670M - 710M; non-GAAP EPS: $5.05 - 5.30; free cash flow: $800M - 900M.

  • HRB

    H&R Block bid down 2.4% after earnings

    • H&R Block (NYSE:HRB) trades 2.44% lower despite topping estimates on both lines of its Q3 report. The company's EBITDA loss of $169M was also lower than anticipated.
    • The company backed its full-year outlook, guiding for revenue of $3.05B to $3.10B and an EBITDA margin of 24% to 26%.
    • H&R Block management says it plans to implement new initiatives for the upcoming tax season, including "transparent" pricing.
    • Previously: H&R Block beats by $0.11, beats on revenue (Dec. 6)
